meanings.definition: The state or quality of being dim.
meanings.sent1: The dimness of the room made it hard to see.
meanings.sent2: The dimness of the stars in the night sky was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent3: The dimness of the situation was like trying to solve a puzzle in the dark.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was clouded by the dimness of time.
meanings.sent5: The dimness of the forest at night was both eerie and enchanting.

meanings.sent1: The candle flickered in the dimness of the room.
meanings.sent2: The dimness of the lantern cast a soft glow around the campsite.
meanings.sent3: The dimness of the firefly's light seemed to dance in the night.
meanings.sent4: The dimness of the street lamp barely illuminated the path.
meanings.sent5: The dimness of the flashlight was a welcome guide in the dark cave.

meanings.definition: A lack of brightness or clarity.
meanings.sent1: The dimness of the old photograph made it hard to recognize faces.
meanings.sent2: The dimness of the memory faded with time.
meanings.sent3: The dimness of the mirror's reflection distorted her features.
meanings.sent4: The dimness of the fog obscured the view of the mountains.
meanings.sent5: The dimness of the water made it impossible to see what lurked beneath.
